page.title: 17BRUCEFIELD ESTATE LIVINGSTON
page.content: {Brucefield Industrial Estate,}situated south-west of Bellsquarry Village, comprises 67 units and was built, in phases, by Livingston Development Corporation, starting in 1977. We made a survey and paid visits to 2 units in particular. We discovered that many factories are involved in Modern Technology-computers;computer software ;computer stationery;printed circuit boards; silicon chips and{nuclear {medicine}including gamma cameras, medical scanners and lasers. There are three food manufacturers - of bacon, sweets and biscuits. There is a Lothian Regional College for training in joinery. Others include double glazing firms; Scottish jewellery making; television rental and repairs; light engineering and the selling, repairing and hiring of generators, lawnmowers, fruit machines and videos.
